Posts.Content: I work in a vets and we have been asked by our head office to display a sign in the waiting area and consult rooms about vaccines and immunocompromised  clients.   It advises asking the vets advice before having a pets vaccine administered.  It is mainly the kennel cough that is a live vaccine, I think part of the concern is that some dogs can sneeze for a while after having it and so spread it around !    It’s similar to concerns about avoiding  children who have had the  flu vaccine really.
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and my dog

Posts.Content: Hi careermindedoptimist I’m pretty similar to you , grade 3 , er+ , Her neg , nodes clear , 11mm IDC  and 10mm DCIS .   I had a lumpectomy though.  I’ve had my Oncotype result which unfortunately was 42. So Chemo is starting in 10 days.   Don’t know what I would have decided if it had been in the intermediate area , think I would still lean towards chemo but it’s all down to personal decision I suppose.  Nothing else to add at the moment as just waiting for it all to start .   I meet the chemo nurses on a Thursday to go through what’s going to happen and see the chemo department.  Best of luck for your results  Jo x
Posts.Title: ER positive clear nodes grade 3 and waiting on oncotype results.....
